CONJUGATES: doctor (noun singular) | doctors (noun plural) | doctor (verb present tense, 1st/2nd person singular/plural, 3rd person plural) | doctors (verb present tense, 3rd person singular) | doctored (verb past tense/past participle) | doctoring (verb present participle)
ETYMOLOGY: From Old French doctour, from Latin doctor ('teacher'), from docere ('to teach'). Originally referred to a highly educated person.
SINCE: Late 13th century (as 'teacher'); 14th century (as 'person skilled in medicine')

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word that refers to a person, place, thing, event, substance, or quality
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A person who is qualified to practice medicine; a physician.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: After years of study, she finally became a doctor.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 经过多年的学习，她终于成为一名医生。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word that refers to a person, place, thing, event, substance, or quality
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A person who has obtained a doctorate (the highest academic degree). Used as a title.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Dr. Smith will deliver the keynote address at the conference.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 史密斯博士将在会议上发表主题演讲。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: transitive verb: a verb that takes one or more objects
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To treat, mend, or repair something.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He had to doctor his old bicycle to make it rideable again.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他不得不修理他的旧自行车才能让它重新骑行。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: transitive verb: a verb that takes one or more objects
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To tamper with something, especially to falsify or alter it deceptively.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 篡改；伪造 (尤指文件或数据)
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The politician was accused of doctoring the evidence to suit his narrative.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这位政客被指控篡改证据以迎合他的说辞。

REGISTER: General (for medical and academic meanings), Informal (for verb meanings)
